recipe_name: Lentil and cumin soup with pesto
author: James Martin
method: Heat the lentils, red wine, water, parsley and cumin seeds in a saucepan over a medium heat and simmer for five minutes. Season with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper. Add the cream and turn up the heat to bring the mixture up to a boil. Transfer into a food processor and blend until smooth. For the pesto, place the basil leaves and oil in the bowl of a food processor and blend until smooth and combined. Transfer the soup into a serving bowl and carefully stir through some of the pesto. To serve, top with a spoonful of yoghurt and sprinkle over the chopped chives and oil.
ingredients: 1 can of lentils, rinsed and drained,  100ml/4fl oz red wine,  150ml/6fl oz water,  handful fresh parsley, chopped,  1 tsp cumin seeds,  100ml/4fl oz double cream,  bunch fresh basil, leaves only,  3 tbsp olive oil,  spoonful of yoghurt,  sprinkling of chopped chives, to serve,  drizzle of oil, to serve
